Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi , also known as
Mahatma
Gandhi , was a famous figure who helped lead India to independence .
After returning to India after studying in South Africa , Gandhi began spreading his philosophy , and many Gandhian ideas are still taught and followed to this day .
This wikiHow will take you through some core tenets of Gandhian philosophy , and help you live as a Gandhian .

item.s: Learn about Gandhi .
Learning about Gandhi and how he lives his life can help you learn how to better live as a Gandhian , as Gandhi exemplifies the values outlined below .

item.s: Prioritize means over ends .
Gandhi strongly believed in the primacy of means over ends .
Even the noblest goal must be pursued only through the right means , even if it means it takes longer to achieve .
For instance , Gandhi highly valued nonviolence , and chose to attain his goals only through nonviolent means .
Before taking any hasty action , ask yourself - am I going about this the right way ?
Can I be sure that my action does not violate the fundamental principles of truth and nonviolence ?
Do n't avoid concerning yourself with ends altogether .

The realization of truth and pursuit of
Brahman
are not incompatible with pursuing noble goals .

item.s:
Center your life around the search for
satya
, or Truth .
Gandhian philosophy lays heavy emphasis on searching for the truth and centering your life around it .
The realization of Truth , according to Gandhi , comes from devoting your life to the search for truth , even at the expense of other worldly things .
Avoid falling prey to material pleasures .
While they may be tempting , such things only distract one from the search for Truth .
Meditating helps you focus and be at peace with yourself , and aids the search for Truth .

Practice
Ahimsa
or Nonviolence .
The idea of nonviolence is central to Gandhi 's philosophy .
Throughout his fight for independence , Gandhi stressed the importance of passive and nonviolent forms of resistance .

, is a complex concept that preaches celibacy , faith in God , and a mastery over one 's own actions such that one does not fall prey to the pleasures of the flesh .

To practice Brahmacharya is to renounce activities that have no place in the path to
Brahma
.
To Gandhi , fasting was a way to cleanse and discipline the mind , body , and soul .
It helps develop the mental fortitude necessary to practice Gandhi 's teachings .
Gandhi himself fasted several times in his lifetime .

item.s: Teach yourself to be self sufficient .

Gandhi 's ideas of
swarajya
, which he outlined in his work
Hind Swaraj
, emphasize self-sufficiency and independence .

Learning to cut back on material desires can be hard .
Take it slowly and eliminate vices not conducive to Gandhism step by step .
